com.snda.storage.service.impl.rest.httpclient

Class RestStorageService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snda.storage.service.StorageService
      • com.snda.storage.service.impl.rest.httpclient.RestStorageService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CSRequestAuthorizer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CSService

    public abstract class RestStorageService
extends StorageService
implements CSRequestAuthorizer
    Abstract REST/HTTP implementation of an CSService based on the HttpClient library.

    Author:
    snda

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestStorageService

        public RestStorageService(ProviderCredentials credentials)
        Constructs the service and initializes the properties.

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpClient

        public org.apache.http.client.HttpClient getHttpClient()
        Returns:
        the HTTP client for this service.

      • setHttpClient

        public void setHttpClient(org.apache.http.client.HttpClient httpClient)
        Replaces the service's default HTTP client. This method should only be used by advanced users.
        Parameters:
        httpClient - the client that will replace the default client created by the class constructor.

      • putObjectWithSignedUrl

        public CSObject putObjectWithSignedUrl(java.lang.String signedPutUrl,
                              CSObject object)
        Puts an object using a pre-signed PUT URL generated for that object.

        This operation does not required any CS functionality as it merely uploads the object by performing a standard HTTP PUT using the signed URL.

        Parameters:
        signedPutUrl - a signed PUT URL generated with CSService.createSignedPutUrl(String, String, java.util.Map, java.util.Date).
        object - the object to upload, which must correspond to the object for which the URL was signed.
        Returns:
        the CSObject put to CS. The CSObject returned will represent the object created in CS.

      • deleteObjectWithSignedUrl

        public void deleteObjectWithSignedUrl(java.lang.String signedDeleteUrl)
        Deletes an object using a pre-signed DELETE URL generated for that object.

        This operation does not required any CS functionality as it merely deletes the object by performing a standard HTTP DELETE using the signed URL.

        Parameters:
        signedDeleteUrl - a signed DELETE URL generated with CSService.createSignedDeleteUrl(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.Date, boolean).

      • getObjectWithSignedUrl

        public CSObject getObjectWithSignedUrl(java.lang.String signedGetUrl)
        Gets an object using a pre-signed GET URL generated for that object.

        This operation does not required any CS functionality as it merely uploads the object by performing a standard HTTP GET using the signed URL.

        Parameters:
        signedGetUrl - a signed GET URL generated with CSService.createSignedGetUrl(String, String, java.util.Date).
        Returns:
        the CSObject in CS including all metadata and the object's data input stream.

      • getObjectDetailsWithSignedUrl

        public CSObject getObjectDetailsWithSignedUrl(java.lang.String signedHeadUrl)
        Gets an object's details using a pre-signed HEAD URL generated for that object.

        This operation does not required any CS functionality as it merely uploads the object by performing a standard HTTP HEAD using the signed URL.

        Parameters:
        signedHeadUrl - a signed HEAD URL generated with CSService.createSignedHeadUrl(String, String, java.util.Date).
        Returns:
        the CSObject in CS including all metadata, but without the object's data input stream.

      • authorizeHttpRequest

        public void authorizeHttpRequest(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpRequestBase httpMethod)
        Authorizes an HTTP request by signing it. The signature is based on the target URL, and the signed authorization string is added to the HttpRequestBase object as an Authorization header.
        Specified by:
        authorizeHttpRequest in interface CSRequestAuthorizer
        Parameters:
        httpMethod - the request object
